meanings.definition: To take or seize (private property) by authority
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to confiscate the toy from the student.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to confiscate the stolen goods as evidence.
meanings.sent3: The librarian had to confiscate the noisy book from the giggling child.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to confiscate all the colors from the sky, leaving it gray and dull.
meanings.sent5: The strict lifeguard would confiscate any toys brought to the pool to ensure safety.
